text: Idea - a way to preview blog templates on an existing blog without having to export the blog and import it back into a new blog.
they’re going to point you to the design preview buttons
That doesn’t show any of the blog posts in a listing template though does it?

yea, it does. it’s nice though it would be nice if there was a built in “clone a blog” feature
<https://spin.d.pr/P5PUqx+>

There are times when I need a bunch of posts and  will be adding some functionality to a blog - like some new fields. and I need to test the fields without making the template live. cloning would be the perfect solution
super minor - it’d be nice if the syntax highlighter didn’t highlight prefixes in red, unless HS decides to auto prefix <https://spin.d.pr/f4uDNu+>

Minor convenience feature that would be pretty nifty - right click within code editor has a context menu which has an insert file button. clicking that button allows you to either inject at that location a module snippet, partial include, or any file from the file manager.

example use-case: when I’m coding I don’t like that I have to pull up a new window with the file manager grab the url and come back, it kills the coding zen. :martial_arts_uniform:

And while that seems like a cool integration to add with the chrome extension XD that also sounds like a hell of a lot of work to do through that(API’s, servers, and users managing which HubID’s have that ability because it would have to go to another server. Seems like too much work.)
